timeline.author: OrionDevelopment

timeline.bodyText:
This logic can be abstracted into a protected method in the abstract building: canRecipeBeAddedBasedOnTags(final IToken token) which can then be reused through out the buildings even when the recipe addition logic is changed.
Please rework this as such, since this is a lot of copy pasting.
timeline.author: OrionDevelopment

timeline.message:
Abstracts check for tags in recipes

Signed-off-by: Mark E. Schill <Mark.Schill@cmschill.net>

Merge branch 'version/1.15' into feature/recipe_tags

Signed-off-by: Mark E. Schill <Mark.Schill@cmschill.net>

# Conflicts:
#	build.properties
#	src/main/resources/META-INF/mods.toml

timeline.bodyText: This seems like a duplicate. And why not just make it return true/false ?
timeline.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText:
Because we need three cases:

True means the recipe is allowed.
False means the recipe is explicitly denied.
Null means false unless a following rule allows it.
replies.author: PowerSchill

replies.bodyText:
But do we need it in the crafter + in the worker override?
(Also, we never return null in the method, that's why I asked why we don't return a boolean)
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: Actually we probably don't need it in both places; I am testing that now. The actual canRecipeBeAdded method always returns true or false but the canRecipeBeAddedBasedOnTags needs to be able to say Yes, No, or "I don't care" before letting the builder-specific logic.
replies.author: PowerSchill

replies.bodyText: I mean the canRecipeBeAddedBasedOnTags also atm always is true/false and never null
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: or did you want to return nullable(null) instead of nullable(false) ?
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: I return Optional.ofNullable(false) which is like Null but won't generate null pointer exceptions. You have to set it to something.
replies.author: PowerSchill
Raycoms

timeline.bodyText: the format is messed up in all these classes though.
timeline.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: Compared to the default formatting yeah =D
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: Looks like this was the only one
replies.author: PowerSchill
